subject: Cybersecurity
title: IP Addresses: Your Digital Home Address
description: A quick, practical guide to IP Addresses: Your Digital Home Address.

hook.text: Every device on the internet has a number. That number reveals your approximate location and your internet provider.

buildup.text: An IP address identifies your device on a network. IPv4 uses four numbers (like 192.168.1.1), IPv6 uses hexadecimal.

discovery.text: Public IPs are visible to every website you visit. Private IPs hide behind your router's NAT â€” invisible from outside.

twist.text: IP geolocation databases can pinpoint your city. In 2016, a mapping error directed all 'unknown' U.S. IPs to a Kansas farm.

climax.text: Your IP address is the starting point for both network communication and network attacks.

punchline.text: A Kansas farmer got blamed for every unlocated IP in America.

quiz.question: What information can an IP address reveal?
options: Your approximate location and internet service provider
